stanza.line: Some glory in their birth some in their (a)skill(/a)
Some in their wealth some in their body's (b)force(/b)
Some in their garments though new-fangled (a)ill(/a)
Some in their hawks and hounds some in their (b)horse(/b)
And every humour hath his adjunct (c)pleasure(/c)
Wherein it finds a joy above the (d)rest(/d)
But these particulars are not my (c)measure(/c)
All these I better in one general (d)best(/d)
Thy love is better than high birth to (e)me(/e)
Richer than wealth prouder than garments' (f)costs(/f)
Of more delight than hawks and horses (e)be(/e)
And having thee of all men's pride I (f)boast(/f)
Wretched in this alone that thou mayst (g)take(/g)
All this away and me most wretchcd (g)make(/g)
